Immigration

The topic of the video, answer these questions in video !

  • What comes to mind when you hear the word "immigration"?
  • What's the difference between immigration and emigration?
  • What are the pros and cons of immigration?
  • What factors urge people to immigrate to another country?
  • Is immigration an issue in your country?
  • What laws on immigration would you like your country to impose?
  • Do you think immigration helps us all understand each other better and reduce the cultural differences?
  • Would you take the risk to illegally immigrate? Why/why not? What possible dangers do you foresee?
  • Should illegal immigrants be deported?
  • Do you think that immigrants are treated well in most countries?


Definitions

  • Pros: Means the good things or advantages of something.

    Example: - The pros of immigration are better job opportunities.

  • Cons: Means the bad things or disadvantages of something.

    Example: - The cons of immigration are being far from family.

  • Urge: To strongly encourage or push someone to do something.

    Example: - Poverty might urge people to immigrate to another country.

  • Laws and Impose:

    • Laws are rules made by the government.
    • Impose means to make people follow or obey something.

    Example: - Countries impose laws on immigration to control who enters and stays.

  • Foresee: To predict or see something happening in the future.

    Example: - Can you foresee any problems with illegally immigrating?

  • Treated: How someone behaves or acts toward another person.

    Example: - Do you think immigrants are treated kindly in most countries?
